card.name: Amnesia
card.ability: Target player reveals his or her hand and discards all nonland cards.
card.flavor: "When one has witnessed the unspeakable, 'tis sometimes better to forget."Vervamon the Elder
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If cast targeting yourself, you do have to reveal your hand.

card.name: Angry Mob
card.ability:
Trample
As long as it's your turn, Angry Mob's power and toughness are each equal to 2 plus the number of Swamps your opponents control. As long as it's not your turn, Angry Mob's power and toughness are each 2.

card.name: Apprentice Wizard
card.ability: {U}, {T}: Add {3} to your mana pool.

card.name: Ashes to Ashes
card.ability: Exile two target nonartifact creatures. Ashes to Ashes deals 5 damage to you.
card.flavor:
"All rivers eventually run to the sea. My job is to sort out who goes first."
—Maeveen O'Donagh, Memoirs of a Soldier
card.ruling:
10/1/2009 : If one of the targeted creatures is an illegal target by the time Ashes to Ashes resolves, it still exiles the other one and deals 5 damage to you.
10/1/2009 : If both of the targeted creatures are illegal targets by the time Ashes to Ashes resolves, it's countered. It doesn't deal 5 damage to you.

card.name: Ball Lightning
card.ability:
Trample (If this creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice Ball Lightning.
card.ruling: 2/1/2007 : The creature is sacrificed at the end of every turn in which it is on the battlefield. There is no choice about what turn to sacrifice it.

card.name: Banshee
card.ability: {X}, {T}: Banshee deals half X damage, rounded down, to target creature or player, and half X damage, rounded up, to you.
card.flavor: Some say Banshees are the hounds of Death, baying to herd their prey into the arms of their master.
card.ruling: 10/1/2009 : If the targeted creature or player is an illegal target by the time Banshee's ability resolves, the ability is countered. You won't be dealt damage.

card.name: Barl's Cage
card.ability: {3}: Target creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
card.flavor: For a dozen years the Cage had held Lord Ith, but as the Pretender Mairsil's power weakened, so did the bars.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Does not prevent a creature from untapping at other times. It just stops the "normal" untap during the untap step.
10/1/2009 : You may target any creature with this ability. It doesn't have to be tapped.
10/1/2009 : If the targeted creature is untapped at the time its controller's next untap step begins, this ability has no effect. It won't apply at some later time when the targeted creature is tapped.
10/1/2009 : Barl's Cage doesn't track the creature's controller. If the affected creature changes controllers before its old controller's next untap step, this ability will prevent it from being untapped during its new controller's next untap step.

card.name: Blood Moon
card.ability: Nonbasic lands are Mountains.
card.flavor: Heavy light flooded across the landscape, cloaking everything in deep crimson.
card.ruling: 12/1/2004 : Non-basic lands that are turned into Mountains with Blood Moon are still non-basic. Blood Moon does nothing to change the land's Supertype.

card.name: Blood of the Martyr
card.ability: Until end of turn, if damage would be dealt to any creature, you may have that damage dealt to you instead.
card.flavor: The willow knows what the storm does not: that the power to endure harm outlives the power to inflict it.

card.name: Bog Imp
card.ability: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
card.flavor: On guard for larger dangers, we underestimated the power and speed of the Imp's muck-crusted claws.

card.name: Bog Rats
card.ability: Bog Rats can't be blocked by Walls.
card.flavor: Their stench was vile and strong enough, but not nearly as powerful as their hunger.

card.name: Bone Flute
card.ability: {2}, {T}: All creatures get -1/-0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: After the Battle of Pitdown, Lady Ursnell fashioned the first such instrument out of Lord Ursnell's left leg.
card.ruling: 10/1/2009 : The ability affects only creatures on the battlefield at the time it resolves. A creature that enters the battlefield later in the turn won't get -1/-0.

card.name: Book of Rass
card.ability: {2}, Pay 2 life: Draw a card.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You can't spend yourself to below zero life. You can't spend life you don't have.

card.name: Brainwash
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack unless its controller pays {3}.
card.flavor: "They're not your friends; they despise you. I'm the only one you can count on. Trust me."
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : This ability is paid for during the declare attackers step of the combat phase.
10/4/2004 : If there are multiple combat phases during the turn, the attack cost must be paid each time if you want to attack with the creature.
10/4/2004 : Paying this cost is not an Instant or any other kind of ability, it is an additional cost on the declaration of the attacker.

card.name: Brothers of Fire
card.ability: {1}{R}{R}: Brothers of Fire deals 1 damage to target creature or player and 1 damage to you.
card.flavor: Fire is never a gentle master.

card.name: Carnivorous Plant
card.ability: Defender
card.flavor: "It had a mouth like that of a great beast, and gnashed its teeth as it strained to reach us. I am thankful it possessed no means of locomotion."Vervamon the Elder

card.name: Cave People
card.ability:
Whenever Cave People attacks, it gets +1/-2 until end of turn.
{1}{R}{R}, {T}: Target creature gains mountainwalk until end of turn.

card.name: City of Shadows
card.ability:
{T}, Exile a creature you control: Put a storage counter on City of Shadows.
{T}: Add {X} to your mana pool, where X is the number of storage counters on City of Shadows.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The counters do not go away when it is used.
10/1/2009 : You can activate City of Shadows's second ability while it has no storage counters on it, though it won't add any mana to your mana pool in this case. You've still tapped it for mana, though, in case any abilities (such as the ability of a Fertile Ground enchanting it) care about that.

card.name: Cleansing
card.ability: For each land, destroy that land unless any player pays 1 life.

card.name: Coal Golem
card.ability: {3}, Sacrifice Coal Golem: Add {R}{R}{R} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: "Three such creatures stood burning at the crest of the hill. Only seconds later, the Fireball struck our front line."Lydia, Countess Brellis

card.name: Curse Artifact
card.ability:
Enchant artifact
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted artifact's controller, Curse Artifact deals 2 damage to that player unless he or she sacrifices that artifact.
card.flavor: Voska feared the artifact had come too easily.

card.name: Dance of Many
card.ability:
When Dance of Many enters the battlefield, put a token that's a copy of target nontoken creature onto the battlefield.
When Dance of Many leaves the battlefield, exile the token.
When the token leaves the battlefield, sacrifice Dance of Many.
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Dance of Many unless you pay {U}{U}.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Destroying the creature that was copied will not cause the token creature to be destroyed as well.
10/4/2004 : Each Dance of Many is associated only with its token creature. If one Dance leaves the battlefield, only the corresponding token is affected, not all tokens from all instances of Dance of Many.
10/4/2004 : The ability is targeted and checks the validity of the target when put on the stack and when resolving. If the creature is not still there when the copy ability resolves, the ability is countered and no token is put onto the battlefield. This card remains on the battlefield as an enchantment with no token.
10/4/2004 : The mana cost is copied.
10/4/2004 : Treat the token as entering the battlefield as a copy of the chosen creature. If that creature normally gets counters when entering the battlefield, the token creature gets counters.
10/1/2009 : If Dance of Many leaves the battlefield before its first ability has resolved, its second ability will trigger and do nothing. Then its first ability will resolve and put a token onto the battlefield. That token won't have any connection to a Dance of Many permanent, so it won't be exiled when a Dance of Many leaves the battlefield.

card.name: Dark Heart of the Wood
card.ability: Sacrifice a Forest: You gain 3 life.
card.flavor: Even the Goblins shun this haunted place, where the tree limbs twist in agony and the ground seems to scuttle under your feet.

card.name: Dark Sphere
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice Dark Sphere: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent half that damage, rounded down.
card.flavor: "I was struck senseless for a moment, but revived when the strange curiosity I carried fell to the ground, screaming like a dying animal."Barl, Lord Ith
card.ruling: 4/15/2013 : If two or more of these effects would apply, you apply them sequentially. So if the source would deal 5 damage after two of these abilities have resolved, the first one prevents 2 damage, reducing it to 3 damage, then the second one prevents a further 1 damage, reducing the total damage dealt to 2.

card.name: Deep Water
card.ability: {U}: Until end of turn, if you tap a land you control for mana, it produces {U} instead of any other type.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Deep Waters affects lands you control when it resolves and any lands you gain control of this turn.
8/1/2008 : The amount of mana produced is unchanged, but it will all be {U}.

card.name: Diabolic Machine
card.ability: {3}: Regenerate Diabolic Machine.
card.flavor: "The bolts of our ballistae smashed into the monstrous thing, but our hopes died in our chests as its gears continued turning."Sevti Mukul, The Fall of Alsoor

card.name: Drowned
card.ability: {B}: Regenerate Drowned.
card.flavor: We asked Captain Soll what became of the Serafina, but all he said was, "Ships that go down shouldn't come back up."

card.name: Dust to Dust
card.ability: Exile two target artifacts.
card.flavor: Tervish never noticed that the amulet had vanished. It had disappeared not only from his possession, but from his memory as well.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If one target is removed or becomes invalid after declaration, the other target is still affected.

card.name: Eater of the Dead
card.ability: {0}: If Eater of the Dead is tapped, exile target creature card from a graveyard and untap Eater of the Dead.
card.flavor: Even the putrid muscles of the dead can provide strength to those loathsome enough to consume them.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : It untaps during the resolution of its ability.
9/16/2007 : You can activate the ability whether or not Eater of the Dead is tapped. However, if Eater of the Dead is untapped when the ability resolves, the ability won't do anything.
4/1/2008 : A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

card.name: Electric Eel
card.ability:
When Electric Eel enters the battlefield, it deals 1 damage to you.
{R}{R}: Electric Eel gets +2/+0 until end of turn and deals 1 damage to you.

card.name: Elves of Deep Shadow
card.ability: {T}: Add {B} to your mana pool. Elves of Deep Shadow deals 1 damage to you.
card.flavor: "They are aberrations who have turned on everything we hold sacred. Let them be cast out."Ailheen, Speaker of the Council

card.name: Erosion
card.ability:
Enchant land
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted land's controller, destroy that land unless that player pays {1} or 1 life.

card.name: Eternal Flame
card.ability: Eternal Flame deals X damage to target opponent, where X is the number of Mountains you control. It deals half X damage, rounded up, to you.

card.name: Exorcist
card.ability: {1}{W}, {T}: Destroy target black creature.
card.flavor: Though they often bore little greater charm than the demons they battled, exorcists were always welcome in Scarwood.

card.name: Fasting
card.ability:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a hunger counter on Fasting. Then destroy Fasting if it has five or more hunger counters on it.
If you would begin your draw step, you may skip that step instead. If you do, you gain 2 life.
When you draw a card, destroy Fasting.
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : When you resolve the beginning-of-upkeep triggered ability, you first put a hunger counter on Fasting, then you check how many hunger counters it has. If there are five or more, Fasting is destroyed.
10/1/2008 : The third ability previously instructed you to sacrifice Fasting when you draw a card. This has been changed to destruction, so effects that regenerate it or make it indestructible can keep it on the battlefield.
10/1/2008 : You choose whether or not to skip your draw step as that step begins. This ability is now separate from the beginning-of-upkeep triggered ability.

card.name: Fellwar Stone
card.ability: {T}: Add to your mana pool one mana of any color that a land an opponent controls could produce.
card.flavor:
"What do you have that I cannot obtain?"
—Mairsil, called the Pretender
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : It only produces one mana even if the land can produce more than one.
10/4/2004 : This works even if the opponent's lands are tapped. It only checks what kinds of mana can be produced, not if the abilities that produce them are usable right now.
10/4/2004 : The ability can be activated if the opponent has no lands that produce mana, but the effect will not be able to generate any mana.
10/1/2009 : The colors of mana are white, blue, black, red, and green. Fellwar Stone can't be tapped for colorless mana, even if a land an opponent controls could produce colorless mana.
10/1/2009 : Fellwar Stone checks the effects of all mana-producing abilities of lands your opponents control, but it doesn't check their costs. For example, Vivid Crag has the ability "{T}, Remove a charge counter from Vivid Crag: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool." If an opponent controls Vivid Crag and you control Fellwar Stone, you can tap Fellwar Stone for any color of mana. It doesn't matter whether Vivid Crag has a charge counter on it, and it doesn't matter whether it's untapped.
10/1/2009 : When determining what colors of mana your opponents' lands could produce, take into account any applicable replacement effects that would apply to those lands' mana abilities (such as Contamination's effect, for example). If there is more than one, consider them in any possible order.
10/1/2009 : Fellwar Stone doesn't care about any restrictions or riders your opponents' lands (such as Ancient Ziggurat or Hall of the Bandit Lord) put on the mana they produce. It just cares about colors of mana.

card.name: Festival
card.ability:
Cast Festival only during an opponent's upkeep.
Creatures can't attack this turn.
card.flavor: Only after the townsfolk had drawn us into their merry celebration did we discover that their holiday rituals held a deeper purpose.

card.name: Fire and Brimstone
card.ability: Fire and Brimstone deals 4 damage to target player who declared an attacking creature this turn and 4 damage to you.

card.name: Fire Drake
card.ability:
Flying
{R}: Fire Drake gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.

card.name: Fissure
card.ability: Destroy target creature or land. It can't be regenerated.
card.flavor: "Must not all things at the last be swallowed up in death?"Plato

card.name: Flood
card.ability: {U}{U}: Tap target creature without flying.
card.flavor:
"A dash of cool water does wonders to clear a cluttered battlefield."
—Vibekke Ragnild, Witches and War

card.name: Fountain of Youth
card.ability: {2}, {T}: You gain 1 life.
card.flavor: The Fountain had stood in the town square for centuries, but only the pigeons knew its secret.

card.name: Frankenstein's Monster
card.ability: As Frankenstein's Monster enters the battlefield, exile X creature cards from your graveyard. If you can't, put Frankenstein's Monster into its owner's graveyard instead of onto the battlefield. For each creature card exiled this way, Frankenstein's Monster enters the battlefield with a +2/+0, +1/+1, or +0/+2 counter on it.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : X can be any number and it does not have to match the total contents of your graveyard.
4/1/2008 : A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

card.name: Gaea's Touch
card.ability:
You may play an additional land during your turn if that land is a basic Forest.
Sacrifice Gaea's Touch: Add {G}{G} to your mana pool.
card.ruling:
10/1/2009 : Gaea's Touch lets you play an additional land during your turn if it's a basic land and it has the land type Forest. (The two such cards are Forest and Snow-Covered Forest.)
10/1/2009 : If you play a basic Forest during your turn, you must declare whether you're using your standard land play or Gaea's Touch's first ability to do so.
10/1/2009 : If you play a land using Gaea's Touch's first ability, and then Gaea's Touch leaves the battlefield (because you activated its second ability, for instance), the land you played still counts as an additional land play for the turn. If you haven't already, you can still play a land using your standard land play.

card.name: Ghost Ship
card.ability:
Flying
{U}{U}{U}: Regenerate Ghost Ship.
card.flavor: "That phantom prow split the storm as lightning cast its long shadow on the battlefield below."Mireille Gaetane, The Valeriad

card.name: Giant Shark
card.ability:
Giant Shark can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
Whenever Giant Shark blocks or becomes blocked by a creature that has been dealt damage this turn, Giant Shark gets +2/+0 and gains trample until end of turn.
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Giant Shark.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Giant Shark only gains its bonus if the blocking creature was damaged before blocking was declared. Damaging the creature later will not give the Shark the bonus.
10/4/2004 : The bonus happens when a previously damaged creature becomes a blocker and the bonus is not removed if that creature is removed from the blocking situation by any means.
10/4/2004 : If a creature enters a blocking situation with the Giant Shark due to being part of a banded group of attackers, the Shark will get the bonus if that creature is damaged at that time.
10/4/2004 : Giant Shark gets the bonus once for each creature it blocks or is blocked by that meets the criteria.

card.name: Goblin Caves
card.ability:
Enchant land
As long as enchanted land is a basic Mountain, Goblin creatures get +0/+2.
card.flavor: The stench of countless generations of unspeakable activities was enough to loosen both our footing and our stomachs.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Works even if placed on one of your opponent's Mountains.
10/4/2004 : Works if enchanting a Snow-Covered Mountain.

card.name: Goblin Digging Team
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice Goblin Digging Team: Destroy target Wall.
card.flavor: "From down here we can make the whole wall collapse" "Uh, yeah, boss, but how do we get out?"

card.name: Goblin Hero
card.flavor: They attack in an orgy of rage and madness, but only one seemed as focused on killing us as the sheer joy of battle.

card.name: Goblin Rock Sled
card.ability:
Trample
Goblin Rock Sled doesn't untap during your untap step if it attacked during your last turn.
Goblin Rock Sled can't attack unless defending player controls a Mountain.

card.name: Goblin Shrine
card.ability:
Enchant land
As long as enchanted land is a basic Mountain, Goblin creatures get +1/+0.
When Goblin Shrine leaves the battlefield, it deals 1 damage to each Goblin creature.
card.flavor: "I knew it weren't no ordinary pile of—you know."Norin the Wary
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Works even if placed on one of your opponent's Mountains.

card.name: Goblin Wizard
card.ability:
{T}: You may put a Goblin permanent card from your hand onto the battlefield.
{R}: Target Goblin gains protection from white until end of turn.
card.ruling: 5/1/2007 : Putting the card onto the battlefield is optional.  When the ability resolves, you can choose not to.

card.name: Goblins of the Flarg
card.ability:
Mountainwalk
When you control a Dwarf, sacrifice Goblins of the Flarg.

card.name: Grave Robbers
card.ability: {B}, {T}: Exile target artifact card from a graveyard. You gain 2 life.
card.flavor: "If you don't have your health, you don't have anything."Proverb
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If the target is not there on resolution, you do not gain the life.
10/4/2004 : This exiles the artifact on resolution, but you choose it as a target when activating the ability.

card.name: Hidden Path
card.ability: Green creatures have forestwalk.
card.flavor: "Where moments before we were lost beyond hope, the strange, floating lights showed us the way and restored our morale."Vervamon the Elder

card.name: Holy Light
card.ability: Nonwhite creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: "Bathed in hallowed light, the infidels looked upon the impurities of their souls and despaired."The Book of Tal

card.name: Inferno
card.ability: Inferno deals 6 damage to each creature and each player.
card.flavor: "Any scrap of compassion that still existed in my soul was permanently snuffed out when they cast me out into the flames."Mairsil, called the Pretender

card.name: Inquisition
card.ability: Target player reveals his or her hand. Inquisition deals damage to that player equal to the number of white cards in his or her hand.
card.flavor: Many of those entrusted to Primata Delphine's care tended to express themselves with screams.

card.name: Knights of Thorn
card.ability: Protection from red; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
card.flavor: "With a great cry, the Goblin host broke and ran as the first wave of Knights penetrated its ranks."Tivadar of Thorn, History of the Goblin Wars
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
10/1/2008 : A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
10/1/2008 : Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
10/1/2009 : If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

card.name: Land Leeches
card.ability: First strike
card.flavor: "The standard cure for leeches requires the application of burning embers. Alternative methods must be devised should an ember of sufficient size prove more harmful than the leech."Vervamon the Elder

card.name: Leviathan
card.ability:
Trample
Leviathan enters the battlefield tapped and doesn't untap during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may sacrifice two Islands. If you do, untap Leviathan.
Leviathan can't attack unless you sacrifice two Islands.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You don't have to pay the untap cost if it is untapped outside the upkeep phase or is untapped by an effect.

card.name: Living Armor
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice Living Armor: Put X +0/+1 counters on target creature, where X is that creature's converted mana cost.
card.flavor: Though it affords excellent protection, few don this armor. The process is uncomfortable and not easily reversed.

card.name: Lurker
card.ability: Lurker can't be the target of spells unless it attacked or blocked this turn.
card.flavor:
"Each night we felt it watching us from the darkness beyond our fire. We only had one pack horse left."
—Maeveen O'Donagh, Memoirs of a Soldier

card.name: Mana Clash
card.ability: You and target opponent each flip a coin. Mana Clash deals 1 damage to each player whose coin comes up tails. Repeat this process until both players' coins come up heads on the same flip.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Always affects the player and targets one of his or her opponents.
10/4/2004 : Each point of damage is dealt separately, so if you are damaged twice by this spell, each time is considered a separate time this source deals damage.
10/4/2004 : This card's coin flip has no winner or loser.

card.name: Mana Vortex
card.ability:
When you cast Mana Vortex, counter it unless you sacrifice a land.
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player sacrifices a land.
When there are no lands on the battlefield, sacrifice Mana Vortex.
card.ruling:
10/1/2009 : When you cast Mana Vortex, its first ability triggers and goes on the stack on top of the Mana Vortex spell. The triggered ability resolves first. When it resolves, you either sacrifice a land or you counter Mana Vortex.
10/1/2009 : Mana Vortex's third ability is a "state trigger." Once a state trigger triggers, it won't trigger again as long as the ability is on the stack. If the ability is countered and the trigger condition is still true, it will immediately trigger again.

card.name: Marsh Gas
card.ability: All creatures get -2/-0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: "Comes right outta th' ground. If ya can smell it, it's too late."Keevy Bogsbury

card.name: Marsh Goblins
card.ability: Swampwalk
card.flavor: Even the other Goblin races shun the Marsh Goblins, thanks to certain unwholesome customs they practice.

card.name: Marsh Viper
card.ability: Whenever Marsh Viper deals damage to a player, that player gets two poison counters. (A player with ten or more poison counters loses the game.)
card.flavor:
"All we had left were their black and bloated bodies."Maeveen
O'Donagh, Memoirs of a Soldier

card.name: Martyr's Cry
card.ability: Exile all white creatures. For each creature exiled this way, its controller draws a card.
card.flavor: "It is only fitting that one such as I should die in pursuit of knowledge."Vervamon the Elder
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Only affects creatures on the battlefield, not ones in hands or graveyards.

card.name: Maze of Ith
card.ability: {T}: Untap target attacking creature. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by that creature this turn.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Can target an untapped attacking creature. Both parts of the effect will try to happen even if one part does nothing useful. So if it tries to untap an already untapped card, it will still make the creature neither deal nor receive damage.
10/4/2004 : The creature is still part of the combat. It just has its damage prevented. Don't infer something from the fact that it becomes untapped.

card.name: Merfolk Assassin
card.ability: {T}: Destroy target creature with islandwalk.
card.ruling: 10/15/2006 : Can target a creature with Snow Islandwalk.

card.name: Mind Bomb
card.ability: Each player may discard up to three cards. Mind Bomb deals damage to each player equal to 3 minus the number of cards he or she discarded this way.

card.name: Miracle Worker
card.ability: {T}: Destroy target Aura attached to a creature you control.
card.flavor: "Those blessed hands could bring surcease to even the most tainted soul."Sister Betje, Miracles of the Saints

card.name: Morale
card.ability: Attacking creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: "After Lacjsi's speech, the Knights grew determined to crush their ancient enemies clan by clan."Tivadar of Thorn, History of the Goblin Wars

card.name: Murk Dwellers
card.ability: Whenever Murk Dwellers attacks and isn't blocked, it gets +2/+0 until end of combat.
card.flavor: When Raganorn unsealed the catacombs, he found more than the dead and their treasures.
card.ruling: 4/15/2013 : An ability that triggers when something "attacks and isn't blocked" triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step.

card.name: Nameless Race
card.ability:
Trample
As Nameless Race enters the battlefield, pay any amount of life. The amount you pay can't be more than the total number of white nontoken permanents your opponents control plus the total number of white cards in their graveyards.
Nameless Race's power and toughness are each equal to the life paid as it entered the battlefield.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If put onto the battlefield by a spell or ability, you pay life during the resolution of that spell or ability.
10/4/2004 : The life payment is made just as the card is being put onto the battlefield.
10/1/2007 : This currently has no creature type.  It's Nameless.

card.name: Necropolis
card.ability:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Exile a creature card from your graveyard: Put X +0/+1 counters on Necropolis, where X is the exiled card's converted mana cost.
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

card.name: Niall Silvain
card.ability: {G}{G}{G}{G}, {T}: Regenerate target creature.
card.flavor: This is his domain, and while you remain here you must value all life as you value your own.

card.name: Orc General
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice another Orc or Goblin: Other Orc creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: "Your army must fear you more than the enemy. Only then will you triumph."Malga Phlegmtooth

card.name: People of the Woods
card.ability: People of the Woods's toughness is equal to the number of Forests you control.
card.flavor: "Their rain of arrows left only myself alive, cowering within a tree hollow. They did not even come out to loot the bodies."Vervamon the Elder

card.name: Pikemen
card.ability: First strike; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
card.flavor: "As the cavalry bore down, we faced them with swords drawn and pikes hidden in the grass at our feet. ‘Don't lift your pikes 'til I give the word,' I said."Maeveen O'Donagh, Memoirs of a Soldier
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
10/1/2008 : A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
10/1/2008 : Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
10/1/2009 : If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

card.name: Preacher
card.ability:
You may choose not to untap Preacher during your untap step.
{T}: Gain control of target creature of an opponent's choice that he or she controls for as long as Preacher remains tapped.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The target of the ability is a creature the chosen opponent controls. As the ability resolves, if the target isn't a creature controlled by the chosen opponent, the ability will be countered. If the ability's target is changed somehow, the new target must be a creature controlled by the chosen opponent.
9/16/2007 : Whether Preacher is tapped is checked continually, starting when the ability is activated. If, before the ability resolves, there's any point at which Preacher is untapped, the ability has no effect -- even if Preacher is tapped again by the time the ability resolves.
9/16/2007 : When you activate the ability, you choose an opponent, then that opponent chooses the target.

card.name: Psychic Allergy
card.ability:
As Psychic Allergy enters the battlefield, choose a color.
At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, Psychic Allergy deals X damage to that player, where X is the number of nontoken permanents of the chosen color he or she controls.
At the beginning of your upkeep, destroy Psychic Allergy unless you sacrifice two Islands.

card.name: Rag Man
card.ability: {B}{B}{B}, {T}: Target opponent reveals his or her hand and discards a creature card at random. Activate this ability only during your turn.
card.flavor: "Aw, he's just a silly, dirty little man. What's to be afraid of?"

card.name: Reflecting Mirror
card.ability: {X}, {T}: Change the target of target spell with a single target if that target is you. The new target must be a player. X is twice the converted mana cost of that spell.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Can't be used on abilities of permanents. Those are abilities and not spells.
10/4/2004 : This spell only changes the target of a spell, and not the player.
10/4/2004 : This can't be used on spells which affect "you" and which do not say they target you.

card.name: Riptide
card.ability: Tap all blue creatures.

card.name: Runesword
card.ability: {3}, {T}: Target attacking creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn. When that creature leaves the battlefield this turn, sacrifice Runesword. If the creature deals damage to a creature this turn, the creature dealt damage can't be regenerated this turn. If a creature dealt damage by the targeted creature would die this turn, exile that creature instead.

card.name: Safe Haven
card.ability:
{2}, {T}: Exile target creature you control.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may sacrifice Safe Haven. If you do, return each card exiled with Safe Haven to the battlefield under its owner's control.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : When creatures return to the battlefield, they are put onto the battlefield as if just cast. Creatures with X in the mana cost are treated as X is zero. Creatures which can pay costs when put onto the battlefield to determine abilities must have those costs paid at this time.
10/4/2004 : Token creatures cease to exist when they leave the battlefield, so this effect just exiles them with no chance to bring them back like you can with cards.
10/4/2004 : If changed to another land type, the creature cards are not lost but can't be released until the land reverts to normal.
10/4/2004 : When the creature leaves the battlefield any damage or "will be destroyed at some future time" effects are removed from the creature.
10/4/2004 : Auras on creatures are put into the graveyard and counters on creatures are removed when the creatures are sent to the Haven.
10/4/2004 : Creatures return to the control of their owners, regardless of who controls the Haven when it is sacrificed.
10/4/2004 : All cards in the Haven stay there even if they cease to be creatures. When the Haven is sacrificed, the cards come back onto the battlefield whether or not they are creatures.
10/4/2004 : Creatures return to the battlefield simultaneously.

card.name: Savaen Elves
card.ability: {G}{G}, {T}: Destroy target Aura attached to a land.
card.flavor: "Purity of magic can only come from purity of the land. How can a meal nourish if the ingredients are spoiled?Sidaine of Savaen

card.name: Scarecrow
card.ability: {6}, {T}: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you this turn by creatures with flying.
card.flavor: There was more malice in its button eyes than should have been possible in something that had never known life.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Even prevents non-combat damage from flying creatures.

card.name: Scarwood Bandits
card.ability:
Forestwalk
{2}{G}, {T}: Unless an opponent pays {2}, gain control of target artifact for as long as Scarwood Bandits remains on the battlefield.

card.name: Scarwood Goblins
card.flavor: Larger and more cunning than most Goblins, Scarwood Goblins are thankfully found only in isolated pockets.

card.name: Scarwood Hag
card.ability:
{G}{G}{G}{G}, {T}: Target creature gains forestwalk until end of turn.
{T}: Target creature loses forestwalk until end of turn.

card.name: Scavenger Folk
card.ability: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Scavenger Folk: Destroy target artifact.
card.flavor: String, weapons, wax, or jewels—it makes no difference. Leave nothing unguarded in Scarwood.

card.name: Season of the Witch
card.ability:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Season of the Witch unless you pay 2 life.
At the beginning of the end step, destroy all untapped creatures that didn't attack this turn, except for creatures that couldn't attack.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Any creatures which can't attack for some reason are exempted from the effect.
10/4/2004 : You are not forced to do everything in your power to make something attack. But if you do enable something to attack, and then don't, it will die.
10/4/2004 : It looks back to see which creatures could have attacked during the "declare attackers" step of combat even if this card was not on the battlefield when the attack was declared.
10/4/2004 : It checks at the end of every turn.

card.name: Sisters of the Flame
card.ability: {T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: We are many wicks sharing a common tallow; we feed the skies with the ashes of our prey.

card.name: Skull of Orm
card.ability: {5}, {T}: Return target enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: Though lifeless, the Skull still possessed a strange power over the flow of magic.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Can bring back any enchantment.

card.name: Sorrow's Path
card.ability:
{T}: Choose two target blocking creatures an opponent controls. If each of those creatures could block all creatures that the other is blocking, remove both of them from combat. Each one then blocks all creatures the other was blocking.
Whenever Sorrow's Path becomes tapped, it deals 2 damage to you and each creature you control.
card.ruling:
2/1/2009 : This has two abilities. The second ability triggers any time it becomes tapped, whether to pay for its ability or not.
10/1/2009 : The first ability can target any two blocking creatures a single opponent controls. Whether those creatures could block all creatures the other is blocking isn't determined until the ability resolves.
10/1/2009 : A "blocking creature" is one that has been declared as a blocker this combat, or one that was put onto the battlefield blocking this combat. Unless that creature leaves combat, it continues to be a blocking creature through the end of combat step, even if the creature or creatures that it was blocking are no longer on the battlefield or have otherwise left combat by then.
10/1/2009 : When Sorrow's Path's first ability is activated, its second ability triggers and goes on the stack on top of the first ability. The second ability resolves first, and may cause some of the attacking creatures to be dealt lethal damage.
10/1/2009 : When determining whether a creature could block all creatures the other is blocking, take into account evasion abilities (like flying), protection abilities, and other blocking restrictions, as well as abilities that allow a creature to block multiple creatures or block as though a certain condition were true. Take into account whether those creatures are tapped, but not whether they have costs to block (since those apply only as blockers are declared).
10/1/2009 : When the first ability resolves, if all the creatures that one of the targeted creatures was blocking have left combat, then the other targeted creature is considered to be able to block all creatures the first creature is blocking. If the ability has its full effect, the second creature will be removed from combat but not returned to combat; it doesn't block anything.
10/1/2009 : Abilities that trigger whenever one of the targeted creatures blocks will trigger when the first ability resolves, because those creatures will change from not blocking (since they're removed from combat) to blocking. It doesn't matter if those abilities triggered when those creatures blocked the first time. Abilities that trigger whenever one of the attacking creatures becomes blocked will not trigger again, because they never stopped being blocked creatures. Abilities that trigger whenever a creature blocks one of the attacking creatures will trigger again, though; those kinds of abilities trigger once for each creature that blocks.

card.name: Spitting Slug
card.ability: Whenever Spitting Slug blocks or becomes blocked, you may pay {1}{G}. If you do, Spitting Slug gains first strike until end of turn. Otherwise, each creature blocking or blocked by Spitting Slug gains first strike until end of turn.

card.name: Squire
card.flavor: "Of twenty yeer of age he was, I gesse. Of his stature he was of even lengthe. And wonderly deliver, and greete of strengthe."Geoffrey Chaucer, The Canterbury Tales

card.name: Standing Stones
card.ability: {1}, {T}, Pay 1 life: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

card.name: Stone Calendar
card.ability: Spells you cast cost up to {1} less to cast.
card.flavor: The Pretender Mairsil ordered a great Calendar drawn up to show when the paths to the Dark Lands were strongest.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Does not change the mana cost of the spell, it just reduces what you pay for it.
10/4/2004 : You may choose not to apply Stone Calendar's cost reduction effect.

card.name: Sunken City
card.ability:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Sunken City unless you pay {U}{U}.
Blue creatures get +1/+1.

card.name: Tangle Kelp
card.ability:
Enchant creature
When Tangle Kelp enters the battlefield, tap enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step if it attacked during its controller's last turn.

card.name: The Fallen
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, The Fallen deals 1 damage to each opponent it has dealt damage to this game.
card.flavor: Magic often masters those who cannot master it.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : It stops damaging players and forgets which players it damaged when it leaves the battlefield.
9/16/2007 : If The Fallen phases out and back in, it remembers which players it has dealt damage to this game.
9/16/2007 : The Fallen's ability causes it to deal damage only to opponents of its current controller. If The Fallen has dealt damage to you, and then you gain control of it, you won't be damaged during your upkeep.
9/16/2007 : The effect isn't cumulative. When it resolves, The Fallen deals 1 damage to each opponent previously dealt damage by it, regardless of how many times The Fallen dealt damage to that opponent before.

card.name: Tivadar's Crusade
card.ability: Destroy all Goblins.

card.name: Tormod's Crypt
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice Tormod's Crypt: Exile all cards from target player's graveyard.
card.flavor: The dark opening seemed to breathe the cold, damp air of the dead earth in a steady rhythm.

card.name: Tower of Coireall
card.ability: {T}: Target creature can't be blocked by Walls this turn.

card.name: Tracker
card.ability: {G}{G}, {T}: Tracker deals damage equal to its power to target creature. That creature deals damage equal to its power to Tracker.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Giving either creature first strike does not affect the ability.
10/4/2004 : If this leaves the battlefield before its activated ability resolves, it will still deal damage to the targeted creature. On the other hand, if the targeted creature leaves the battlefield before the ability resolves, the ability will be countered and no damage will be dealt.
10/1/2009 : You may have Tracker target itself with its own ability. If you do, Tracker will deal damage to itself equal to its power, then immediately do it again.

card.name: Uncle Istvan
card.ability: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Uncle Istvan by creatures.
card.flavor: Solitude drove the old hermit insane. Now he only keeps company with those he can catch.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Works even on damage from activated abilities of creatures such as Prodigal Sorcerer.

card.name: Venom
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature blocks or becomes blocked by a non-Wall creature, destroy the other creature at end of combat.
card.flavor: "I told him it was just a flesh wound, a wee scratch, but the next time I looked at him, poor Tadhg was dead and gone."Maeveen O'Donagh, Memoirs of a Soldier
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If this Aura is moved onto a creature after blockers are declared, creatures blocking the newly-enchanted creature are not affected. This is because the ability triggers at the time blocking occurs.

card.name: Wand of Ith
card.ability: {3}, {T}: Target player reveals a card at random from his or her hand. If it's a land card, that player discards it unless he or she pays 1 life. If it isn't a land card, the player discards it unless he or she pays life equal to its converted mana cost. Activate this ability only during your turn.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Any X in the mana cost of a card is zero for purposes of the Wand.

card.name: War Barge
card.ability: {3}: Target creature gains islandwalk until end of turn. When War Barge leaves the battlefield this turn, destroy that creature. A creature destroyed this way can't be regenerated.

card.name: Water Wurm
card.ability: Water Wurm gets +0/+1 as long as an opponent controls an Island.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Only gets the bonus once even if more than one opponent has an Island on the battlefield.

card.name: Whippoorwill
card.ability: {G}{G}, {T}: Target creature can't be regenerated this turn. Damage that would be dealt to that creature this turn can't be prevented or dealt instead to another creature or player. When the creature dies this turn, exile the creature.
card.flavor: If the Whippoorwill remains silent, the soul has not reached its reward.

card.name: Witch Hunter
card.ability:
{T}: Witch Hunter deals 1 damage to target player.
{1}{W}{W}, {T}: Return target creature an opponent controls to its owner's hand.

card.name: Word of Binding
card.ability: Tap X target creatures.
card.flavor: "That was the worst experience of my days, standing there helpless as they killed my whole troop."Maeveen O'Donagh, Memoirs of a Soldier

card.name: Worms of the Earth
card.ability:
Players can't play lands.
Lands can't enter the battlefield.
At the beginning of each upkeep, any player may sacrifice two lands or have Worms of the Earth deal 5 damage to him or her. If a player does either, destroy Worms of the Earth.
card.flavor: The ground collapsed, leaving nothing but the great Worms' mucous residues.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Land can't enter the battlefield, so an effect that "puts a land onto the battlefield" won't do anything, and the land will stay where it is.
10/4/2004 : If you cast a spell or activate an ability that lets you put a land onto the battlefield, the effect fails. You'll still do everything else the spell or ability tells you to do, such as shuffle the library.
5/1/2006 : In Two-Headed Giant, triggers only once per upkeep, not once for each player.
8/1/2008 : If a permanent spell tries to enter the battlefield as a land during its resolution (for instance, a Clone entering the battlefield as a copy of a Dryad Arbor or an animated Mutavault), it is put into its owner's graveyard instead of entering the battlefield. It never enters the battlefield, so abilities that would have triggered on it entering the battlefield won't trigger.

card.name: Wormwood Treefolk
card.ability:
{G}{G}: Wormwood Treefolk gains forestwalk until end of turn and deals 2 damage to you.
{B}{B}: Wormwood Treefolk gains swampwalk until end of turn and deals 2 damage to you.
card.ruling: 10/1/2009 : Causing Wormwood Treefolk to gain forestwalk or swampwalk is useful only during the declare attackers step or earlier. Once it becomes blocked, giving it a landwalk ability won't change that.
